page.title: 08Kirkconnel:Education
page.content: The village Primary School closed in 1966, the few remaining pupils transferring to the school in the adjacent housing development of Kelloholm. When Fauldhead Colliery closed in 1968 many families moved to other coal-fields(Nottingham,Lothian and South Yorkshire) causing a severe decline in school rolls. Three years later, in 1971, Kirkconnel Junior Secondary was closed and the pupils transferred to Sanquhar Academy. Prior to this only those pupils who were to follow 'Ordinary' or 'Higher' Grade Examination courses had to make the 6km journey, by 'bus, to the Academy. Current financial restraints have severely curtailed Further Educational activities and the only class meeting currently is in Dress-making. In past years Motor Engineering,Woodwork and Commercial Subjects were also offered.
